title: Argentina's Default: When a Country Goes Bankrupt
description: A micro-lesson that makes Argentina's Default: When a Country Goes Bankrupt usable.

hook.text: In December 2001, Argentina defaulted on $95 billion in debt â€” the largest sovereign default in history at the time.

buildup.text: Argentina had pegged its peso 1:1 to the US dollar.

discovery.text: When the peg became unsustainable, the government froze bank accounts. Riots erupted.

twist.text: After defaulting and devaluing, Argentina's economy grew 63% in six years.

climax.text: Argentina proved that sovereign default isn't the end.

punchline.text: Going bankrupt was the best economic decision Argentina made.

quiz.question: What happened to Argentina's economy after its 2001 default?
options: The economy grew 63% over six years as default relieved the debt burden
